title: Bachelor of Science - Organic Chemistry | Hunter College - City University of New York
description: • Synthesized and characterized theoretically significant molecules to expand our understanding of aromaticity

title: MS and PhD - Molecular Neuroscience | Columbia University Irving Medical Center
description:
• Characterized a novel role of the amyloid precursor protein (APP) in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer’s disease.
  • Trained and supervised several undergraduate students.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow | Columbia University Irving Medical Center
description:
• Investigated the role of small Rho-GTPases in Alzheimer’s disease, which have also been linked to various cancers
  • Contributed to a bioinformatics project for a non-biased approach to identify Alzheimer’s disease associated genes
  • Generated and characterized transgenic mouse models to investigate the roles of several novel genes in driving Alzheimer’s disease pathology
  • Developed various gene editing tools (RNAi, viral vectors) to identify molecular pathways contributing to synaptic dysfunction
  • Engineered and characterized various stable cell lines
  • Organized journal club sessions for graduate students
  • Trained several undergraduate and master’s students

title: Principal Investigator | Columbia University Irving Medical Center
description:
• Led a translational research program focused on identifying novel pathogenic pathways and druggable proteins involved in Alzheimer’s and Huntington’s disease.
  • Designed experiments, reviewed and interpreted data, performed quality control, and managed records.
  • Procured and allocated resources to research projects, including equipment, supplies and funds; recruited, trained and supervised staff
  • Managed daily laboratory operations, including establishing priorities and assignments, and maintaining staff morale; troubleshooted and resolved technical difficulties and documentation issues related to methods, data and GLP compliance.
  • Drafted and reviewed journal and grant manuscripts, SOPs, protocols, and progress reports.
  • Established and maintained cross-functional institutional and international collaborations.
  • Served on various advisory committees.
  • Conducted lectures for medical and graduate students; led various career development workshops.

title: Certificate - Data Analytics and Visualization | Columbia University School of Engineering
description:
• E.T.L (Pandas, Numpy, SciPy, BeautifulSoup, Postgres, MongDB), JavaScript, HTML/CSS
  • Data visualization (Matplotlib, Plotly, Leaflet, D3, Tableau)
  • Machine Learning (Scikit, TensorFlow)

title: Data Science Consultant | Analytics Intell
description:
• Provide executive leadership team with insights, analytics and recommendation, enabling effective strategic planning across all business units and product lines. Identify and recommend improvement strategies for key performance indicators.
  • Research and develop machine learning models to improve the quality of user-facing products (optimal casino slot machine placement and table game pricing recommendations; identification of casino player at high-risk of churning, recommendation engine for casino players).

title: Assistant Director for Research Integrity and Compliance | Columbia University
description:
• Expert in research compliance. Educate faculty and staff at all levels to ensure compliance with the Conflict-of-Interest regulations and policies that are applicable to research at Columbia University.
  • Monitor and ensure research compliance with responsible conduct of research training requirements from funding agencies. Develop courses and webinars for faculty and post-docs. Provide resources to facilitate research in the area of compliance. Help with investigations regarding research misconduct.
  • Identified need for metrics to define success to measure impact of outreach initiatives and trainings. Develop outreach initiatives for in-person or virtual training in responsible conduct of research training.
  • Provide technical assistance in evaluation of noncompliance materials including forensic analyses of images and information along with use of plagiarism software.
